abstract: Citigroup has raised $3.3 billion for private equity investments, highlighting the growing eagerness of Wall Street banks to take part in the high-risk, high-return boom in leveraged buyouts. The fresh pool of money, to be announced on Monday, exceeds the bank’s $2.5 billion target and includes commitments from clients and employees, as well as $1 billion of the bank’s own balance sheet. The fund, Citigroup Capital Partners II, will be used to strike deals in a variety of industries and regions alongside other private equity firms.
